Results.Name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
Results.Description: We fundraise to enhance Great Ormond Street Hospital’s ability to transform the health and wellbeing of children and young people. Donations help to fund advanced medical equipment, child and family support services, pioneering research and rebuilding and refurbishment.
Results.ProfileWhat: help the hospital offer a better future
Results.ProfileWhy: seriously ill children across the UK

Results.Highlight: ... a collaboration between GOSH and the Institute of Child...
Results.Name: Smiles with Grace
Results.Description: A charity formed by Grace Boxall a teenager in remission from a brain tumour. We are sponsoring a collaboration between GOSH and the Institute of Child Research to develop a bio-market for spinal lipoma. Unfortunately Grace lost her battle against cancer on 26th Sept '13.Thank you for your support.

Results.Subtext: GOSH Corporate Challenge at tri for life 2017
Results.Name: GOSH Corporate Challenge 2017

Results.Subtext: Could you go without something you love for January? Give it Up for GOSH and fundraise to support the children and families at Great Ormond Street Hospital. (GOSH)
Results.Name: Give it up for GOSH, with the Evening Standard, the Independent, i, and London Live
Results.Description:
Children at GOSH often have to give up the things they love: from not being able to eat treats such as chocolate or chips, to playing outside or being able to spend time at home with mum and dad.

We’re asking you to show your strength and join our brave patients by giving up something you love during January whilst raising much needed funds for the Give to GOSH appeal.

Whether you’re crazy about chocolate, got a serious shopping habit, are hooked on TV, or have a passion for puddings, by giving it up in January you’re helping GOSH continue to be an extraordinary place for the children and families who so desperately need it.

How your money helps

  • £10 could help pay for spacious new bedrooms on the specialist cardiac unit
  • £50 could pay for a parent to stay overnight in our family accommodation unit while their child is at GOSH
  • £80 could cover the costs of one flow meter in our new cardiac unit, a gadget that helps ensure children are getting just the right amount of oxygen while they recover

Results.Subtext: Write your mum a message telling her just how special she is and help transform the lives of seriously ill children at Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH).
Results.Name: A better future for seriously ill children starts this Mother's Day
Results.Description:
This year forget the flowers and ditch the selection box. Show your mum how much you care with a thoughtful gift. 

Sharpen your pencil and get scribbling. Tell her just how important she is. Then say thank you by dedicating a donation to GOSH and help transform young lives. 

How your donation makes a difference 

Just £2 could buy a box of glass microscope slides, which allow our researchers to examine life-threatening illnesses and hunt for clues to beat disease.

£18 could cover the cost of an hour's valuable research time for one of our world leading scientists to make the next breakthrough. 

£44 could help pay for a night’s stay in our family accommodation so parents can stay close by while their child is in hospital.

Results.Subtext: Sunni was born at 7 months premature with brain damage resulting in cerebral palsy. Just4Children needs your support to raise £60,000 for SDR surgery which will improve his movement & walking.
Results.Name: Sunni Boy
Results.Description:
Sunni boy comes from a loving family. He lives with his grandmother and cat Boncuk in Ilford Essex. Inspite of his disability he is a happy and positive boy who is loved by his community. Sunni's dream is to be able to live a normal life where he can do simple things like kick a ball and play chase with his cousin without falling down because of his poor balance. He wishes to be able to jump one day and loves boxing, Batman and playing with lego.

Therefore, we now need your support to raise £60,000 for an SDR (Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy) operation at GOSH.

We want Sunni to be able to have a brighter future, so please share and donate and make his dreams come true.

Thank you x

Results.Subtext:
I got to wipe Harrys name off the wards white board – I’d have LOVED to have rung an End of Treatment Bell.

Please help us to raise the money we need – each bell costs £170.

My aim is to supply a bell to Fox Ward. If we manage to raise more than we need I’d love to supply one to the paediatric oncology ward at our local hospital the Royal Surrey.

Although Harrys treatment is not yet over I have to do something to say thank you to both hospitals for saving our sons life.
Results.Description: We're raising money to buy an End of Treatment Bell because They saved my sons life
Results.PitchFor: buy End of Treatment Bells for GOSH & Royal Surrey
Results.ProfileWhat:
End of Treatment Bells UK are placing bells in children’s hospitals/ wards across the UK for children who have completed gruelling cancer treatments to ring!

Ring this bell
Three times well.
Its toll to clearly say,
My treatments done,
This course is run
And now I’m on my way!

{Inspired by Emma Payton & Maria Watt}

We are raising money to buy an ‘End of Treatment Bell’ for Fox Ward {The Bone Marrow Transplant Ward} at Great Ormond Street Hospital.
Results.ProfileWhy:
My son Harry has had two bone marrow transplants – one when he was 8 months old {this failed} and the second at 16 months old which was successful.
Each transplant we spent over three months in an isolation room on the ward.
Going through transplant is horrific – it’s an emotional rollercoaster full of fear and pain.
I cannot describe the elation we felt when we left Fox Ward for the second time with our baby son 100% donor engrafted.

Results.Subtext:
2 months rent and household bills              £2,500
2 months living/travelling expenses GOSH £   500
Results.Highlight: ...We're raising money to FUND GOSH EXPENSES because...
Results.Description: We're raising money to FUND GOSH EXPENSES because IVY-MA'S family will need to be there for 2months+
Results.ProfileWhat: My beautiful granddaughter IVY-MAI was born 13th July 2015 with a very rare blood disorder severe congenital neutropenia elane which means she has no immune system and must undergo chemotherapy and a bone marrow transplant. Her mum, dad & 3 sisters will need to be with her at Great Ormond Street Hospital for at least 2 months. All expenses will need to be covered, plus rent and household bills will still need to be paid
Results.ProfileWhy: I want to take away the added stress of money worries.

Results.Subtext: The money will be spent on meetings throughout the year, such as allowing everyone to have a cup of tea. The money goes towards trips and activities for the people affected by the cancer. This doesn't fund the activities completely however it helps with the cost for the people going.
Results.Highlight: ...We're raising money to support the charity GOSH...
Results.Description: We're raising money to support the charity GOSH because I am running the Bristol 10K in May to raise this
Results.ProfileWhat: GOSH is a very very small charity, one so small they don't have a account on here. They offer support to individuals and families affected by the cancer and arrange meetings throughout the year along with day trips and activities. They also help fund new equipment to help provide the best surgery for this type of cancer! Last year the money raised went towards a new machine used to help with the removal of the cancer. The money raised will help this support to be continued.
Results.ProfileWhy:
GOSH have supported my Grandma through esophagus cancer, it is a very rare type of cancer. GOSH provide a support group for people who have been affected by the cancer, it's ran by a lady who's husband has unfortunately passed away from it, however she want's to continue supporting others!
They aren't a registered charity on here so all donations will come directly to me where I can pass onto the charity.
